website_summaries.verdict: A quiet, lightweight portable generator for recreational use. It's reliable, but also expensive for its class.
pros: You can take it anywhere and won't be bothered by excessive noise
Smart Throttle adjusts engine speed based to load to improve fuel economy and run quietly
cons: Output is considerably lower than bigger, less-portable generators

customer_reviews.title: Bad Control Unit after 50 hours of use - $700 to repair
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty disappointed with Yamaha on this one. I owned it for just over 3 years and it had MAYBE 50 hours on it. Always started right up (although I condition the fuel in all of my equipment). The control unit went bad in this - it produces 12v but no AC. The control unit costs $700, not including labor to replace. I wanted to stay away from the cheap-knock-off-throw-away generators, but the Yamaha has even less value than the cheap ones now. I can see a replacement part of $300, maybe $350, but really? $700? Things go bad, but you've got to make the parts some what reasonable. In the trash it goes...
customer_reviews.author: notladr

customer_reviews.title: Draining fuel from carburetor may be a horrible hassel.
customer_reviews.text: If this model has the same procedure to drain the fuel out of the carburetor as the one I have then be aware it is extremely difficult to remove the side panel to get to the screw to drain the fuel. The side panel goes into a thick rubber molding and the suction is very strong when trying to remove it. No way it can be done without tools resulting nicking/scratching the cover. They need to install an access port in the cover in order to get to it. These units are made in China. This one on this Amazon page is listed as model EF2000ViSV2 . My model is EF2000iS. Which was also purchased from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Potter St

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Gasoline After Less than 100 Hours of Use Creating an Extreme Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: The video speaks for itself. During a recent power-outage I filled this with gas and started it up. After running for about 15 minutes it died. After opening the side panel I found what you see in the video. Killed all the grass under the generator, and now it's a liability instead of an asset. Tried to contact Yamaha Motors Customer Service, but their customer support voicemail mailbox is full. Please don't buy this. I was lucky to catch it before it caught fire, but you might not be.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tailgating generator.
customer_reviews.text: I followed instructions. Filled it with oil (10w-40) and gasoline (I used pure gas no ethanol and highly recommend this for all small engines). Ran through the check list. Pulled it once and it started. Followed procedure for shut down. I have so far pulled the starting cord 4 times and it started 4 times. Used for tailgating. Econo-mode is extremely quiet. Used a 25 foot heavy extension cord with a surge protector to provide multiple plugin sites. Plugged in TV and antenna booster. Ran for about 3.5 hours using less than 1/2 tank of fuel. Perfect for our needs. Only problem is filling with oil. Be sure to have right funnel before trying this.
customer_reviews.author: John Eastman

customer_reviews.title: A life saver
customer_reviews.text: I've been through 3 hurricanes loosing power for + a week each time. I need to be able to keep my refrigerator cold a fan to sleep at night hook up to Internet using the smallest amount of fuel. During these times I can only get out by boat so being able to manage on less than 1 gallon of fuel a day is great. I sure wanted a 5kw for less money but fuel consumption won the day. Oh I have a Yamaha motorcycle. And Yamaha gas golf cart. Not 1 problem with any of them. Think long and hard about fuel consumption and reliability when purchasing
customer_reviews.author: Richard  Adams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent when you want it, even better when you need it
customer_reviews.text: Do your research on the top brands and realize you get what you pay for. I bought this over the comparable Honda for the fuel capacity, fuel gauge, and manual fuel shut off. I like having as much control as possible. Do your oil changes as requested. I haven't installed one of the run time displays and probably wont but if it came with it then that would be cool. We go camping with it and it's quiet enough to have a conversation with in 20 feet but big foot could probably sneak up on you.
customer_reviews.author: Josh S

customer_reviews.title: Bought my second one, can't get lighter or quieter!
customer_reviews.text: Second one I bought, the newest one has the whole back panel come off (two screws) to add oil, etc. Good to see Yamaha is making incremental improvements over the last one, which wasn't more than 3 months ago. Tried a cheaper orange generator with similar specs (Costco) which was almost half the price, but took it back. Noticeably heavier, and measurably much louder. Subjectively it was a much more annoying noise too in addition to being louder as measure by a sound meter. Soooo, back to the Yamaha. Light, quiet, dependable. SUPER easy to pull start, seemingly low compression, very nice! Runs most of the day on it's gallon of gas.
customer_reviews.author: CinemaMurph

customer_reviews.title: top of the line
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in a hurry before a pending severe storm. I did my research, and knew this was one of the best. While stores in my area had sold out, I had this overnighted. It was delivered surprisingly fast (less than 12 hours), and I had it for the storm. EASY to operate, VERY quiet, it was worth every cent for the peace of mind that it bought. With this, I can run a refrigerator, a TV, and a light very easily. Note also that it is very portable, so you can take it on camping trips if need be, or can move with you.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Pace

customer_reviews.title: Fuel petcock sold me.
customer_reviews.text: Love this generator! I purchased it as a back up to our larger generator, and it has come in handy for a few events where more portable power was needed. This thing is quiet and efficient! I'm glad I purchased the Yamaha rather than the Honda. I like being able to shut the fuel off after use for storage.
customer_reviews.author: E-Rock

customer_reviews.title: A dependable source of power.
customer_reviews.text: Since the electricity often goes off here in Entergyland we thought it wise to obtain a generator to keep the freezers and refrigerators cold [one at a time] in case of another extended outage. Fortunately so far we have only NEEDED to brew coffee with power from the generator. It worked wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Soapguy

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha generator buyer for life.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Yamaha generator, (first one is a 13 yr old 2600 that runs like the day I bought it) and I am nothing short of amazed at Yamahas quality once again. I did all the prep for pre start up, pulled the choke out, slowly pulled the start cord just to see what the compression was like and she came to life. WOW!
customer_reviews.author: Sonny R

customer_reviews.title: Started right up,quiet as a campfire folk guitar.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great LITTLE generator.It is not meant for a whole lotta loads.While it is quiet and dependable,it lacks any brute strenghth at all.That said,it is not meant for brute strenghth or real large loads. It will be there,in an emergency,to charge the battery of a larger piece of equipment,while offering a chance to light a bulb or two.Radio,cell phone charger,ect...small camping genny type stuff. You wont make any enemies while this runs,even after hours..very quiet.Like I said in the headline...guitar music played quietly at a campfire was louder than the yamaha 75 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: CORVETTE

customer_reviews.title: $1000 paper weight
customer_reviews.text: purchased in 2013 after super storm sandy, never used it until last year, 30 hours of run time with a 8 amp load and now NO POWER OUTPUT and out of warranty, motor still runs great. I wish i bought the honda
customer_reviews.author: Scotty V

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha EF2000iS Generator
customer_reviews.text: Although I have only tested/checked this generator so far and not used it for an extended time yet, it seems very good. It comes with no oil in the engine so be sure to follow the directions before initial startup. After filling the generator with oil and pouring in some fuel, my generator started on the first pull of the starter. It runs smooth and fairly quiet and performed well in my own testing of various loads. I like the fuel petcock feature that can be used to run the fuel out of the line before storing. Seems easy to carry and use. Very nice unit for remote tool/lighting usage or emergency power needs.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny M

customer_reviews.title: Good generator.
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet! Works well with my power tools. Hard to start though, and it takes a very, very long time for the unit to die after you've shut the fuel off (which you'll want to do to keep the carburetor clean). Probably a good 5 mins. It's also quite heavy, but no more so than others of its type. I prefer it over the Honda because of its fuel management system.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it really is quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Quiet running and easy to use. I don't care to stand right next to it when it is running, but from 50 feet away I can't hear it over the background noise of the neighborhood. The variable output (load matching) saves gas. It must also be a good luck charm. I bought it after several episodes of the power being out for a whole week following storms (including one in the middle of the winter, which left me without heat), and after the purchase the power has never been out more than 2 hours at a time! So I just run it occasionally to keep it in shape.
customer_reviews.author: E. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Trick to start this generator easily.
customer_reviews.text: Great generator but hard to start - Trick: Tilt the unit about 20 degrees towards the control panel - then pull the starter rope. Of course set on full choke. Took me a year to learn that trick.
customer_reviews.author: WEW333

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't look like a brand new product
customer_reviews.text: Product came with all its original tags, however the box looked damaged at the bottom part and it had tape instead of the clips. The generator came with engine oil, even tough all over in the instructions said it was supposed to be empty, this caused a huge mess since it had overflow by the time we noticed. Uneasy feeling about buying something new and receiving something that looks like it was already used.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge y Moraima Valle

customer_reviews.title: So Good I bought 2
customer_reviews.text: I run a charity during the holiday time and we have a parade float and a concession trailer that we use for fundraisers. The generators are EASY to start. Easy to operate and VERY quiet. The Economy mode is great and though the amount of gas is smaller than the BIG guys, it still last a long time on full load. Our parade float has a sound system and snow machines that we use the generators with and the generators are so quiet you can barely hear them running during the parade. If I needed a 3rd generator, Id but another!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Good dependable product!!
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Easy to use. Quiet. Not too heavy. Great for emergencies & camping. Yamaha builds quality products. If not used often, you need to run monthly or so to keep in good shape and to avoid gas from getting old & clogging up carburetor. (Which goes for ANY gasoline powered item, such as cars & motorcycles.)
customer_reviews.author: starZship

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Besides being relatively quiet and a manageable weight, what I really like about this generator is the twin technology allowing you to connect 2 generators together for more power & the invertor protecting my more sensitive electronics from a power surge. Purchased my first one, it worked well so I chose to purchas the second. I have used these seperately during power outages as well as pairing them up to juice my camper. Hands down one of my best purchases !
customer_reviews.author: Shiroi Sam

customer_reviews.title: If only it didn't require an expedition to refill the oil.
customer_reviews.text: I love this generator. I use in on my off-grid homestead. I've gone through mesquite and salt cedar trees like butter with my electric chain saw, using this generator. It is sooo quiet ( purrs like a kitten) and it is easy enough to carry it around on the homestead. If only it were easier to refill the oil- my goodness, I can't even remember where that darn opening is...
customer_reviews.author: Kopperrose

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Quiet Power
customer_reviews.text: Reliable, Easy to Service, And Quiet. I am purchased 2 of these Generators. One is about a year old and the second is a new addition. The older one has ben reliable and easy to use. The only servicing that that I have needed to perform is changing the oil. Linked together using the kit from Yamaha they easily provide the power needed for a 30 foot RV with a 30 AMP Service. The one warning I would point out is to always use good clean fuel. This goes for any engine, especially small ones.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Work horse generator at a better price than Honda
customer_reviews.text: This generator has seen lots of use since I bought it, charging the batteries on our RV, and powering up the AC lighting and refrigerator circuits simultaneously. We've used it to run portable equipment (electric chain saw and hedge trimmers) when city power wasn't available. I love the thing. It's nice and quiet. Not powerful enough for the microwave on full power or the air conditioner, but it runs everything else just fine. If I go camping in the desert in summer I'll by another one so you can chain them together to power the air conditioner. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Ethosian

customer_reviews.title: I use ethanol free premium gas which works well and is great for long term storage
customer_reviews.text: Had a full season of use with this generator and it works and starts flawlessly. I used it for over 2 months of use camping and have had zero problems. Starts on the first pull and keeps on ticking! I use ethanol free premium gas which works well and is great for long term storage. The gas shut off valve is a prime feature on this generator and after use I just shut off the gas and let it run out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Vanuga

customer_reviews.title: SUPER QUIET AND STARTS 1 PULL
customer_reviews.text: Received in 2 days with prime membership,just prior to hurricane Sandy. Filled with oil and gas, then read instructions for starting, started on first pull. Exceptionally quiet and yes did need it for power outage from hurricane. Keeped fridge going and some lights and recharged a couple of battery packs. Ran for about 3 hours and used very little gas. Very happy with purchase and Amazon service.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Best 2000 watt generator you can buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this generator after lots of research and patience. I chose it over the Honda but it was a close decision. I'm glad I did. Added oil and 2 pulls out of the box it fired right up. It's so quiet it's not loud even when it's at full throttle. I tested it out by plugging in my worm drive skill saw and it powered it with no problem. I have also hooked it up to my camper and it powers everything. That's the reason I bought it was for the campground. Great choice and if you buy it you will be happy too.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Dudleston

customer_reviews.title: Good Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: Am glad I bought it. Everyone should have backup power in case of emergencies. I like it because it's portable so I can take it camping if I need to. Really like the fact that is an run for up to 10 hrs(not on full load) on one gal of gas. Haven't needed to test this yet but have started reliably the couple times I've tested it. My only complaint is it's a little complicated to start. Also wish there is an easy to drain the gas.
customer_reviews.author: Marc N.

customer_reviews.title: Great Inverter Generator
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, powers a refrigerator and freezer during power outages, small and portable.
customer_reviews.author: jdwserv

customer_reviews.title: Awesome generator!
customer_reviews.text: DUMBFOUNDINGLY quiet at full speed when you're standing 3ft away! If you put it about 20ft away and use an extension cord you won't really hear it at all. I love it! I can use it any time at home and my neighbors don't even know. At the campsite I just chain the generator to a tree about 30ft away and never even hear the thing!
customer_reviews.author: R. Sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: Great little generator
customer_reviews.text: This generator has been extensively reviewed, and rated very highly. Having now used it I agree with the consensus that it is easy to start, very quiet, and handles up to rated load comfortably. Despite its plastic casing - which is clearly a key part of its low noise design - it feels extremely solidly built but at the same time is very portable. It steadfastly refuses to clean up my garage or wash the car, but it turns out that isn't in its specifications.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Solid generator that does exactly what I want it to do.
customer_reviews.text: I am able to keep two refrigerators up and running and it still has plenty of power to spare. I run it in full power mode and attach one fridge at a time. When the first fridge finishes with the heavy amp pull, I attach the second one and let it do the same. From that point on, the generator can be cycled down to eco mode.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P. Givens

customer_reviews.title: Good quiet generator
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, slightly bigger than expectations from pictures but true to dimensions. I like that you can turn the gas off to run the carb dry. I live in a small neighborhood so bring quiet was key. Really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Great, quiet generator
customer_reviews.text: Great, quiet generator. I don't use it often, but you can turn off the gas line to the tank and let it drain whatever is in the carb and run it dry to store. I take it with me every time I go camping but don't use it much, but it's a good backup to my solar and it's really quiet.
customer_reviews.author: RobbySkateboard

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I know, the price is out there. But for me, it works, it's small enough to fit in a car seat. It is super quiet. It starts on the first crank, NO GAS SMELL!! I keep it tucked in the corner of my garage out of the way and I forget it is back there. If you have limited space and only need to run small appliances or one at a time this works great! It's user friendly and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: WoodyGapCrawler

customer_reviews.title: What the doctor ordered
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a light/portable/quiet generator and found it in this one. Not sure if a inverter generator is needed but guessing its good insurance against damaging a computer or tv. Is quiet, as I can expect, for a engine running. A bit of a pain filling with oil. Like the gas petcock, so I can run the carb dry. Not sure if it will damage anything but would rather store it without gas in carb (nothing mentioned in instructions), but been doing that with motorcycles for decades. Haven't had it long but like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for 6 month and only used it three times but very pleased so far. Starts the first pull, powers my refrigerator and sump pumps, provided I don't start them all at once. Thinking of getting a second one. I use a fifty foot 10 gage extension cord and Berg external fuel tank. It ran for two days and still had gas left, with the Berg tank attached.
customer_reviews.author: Uniboob

customer_reviews.title: A great little generator
customer_reviews.text: I will admit that it's pricey on a dollars per watt basis, but it is extremely quiet and reliable. Our family now owns three of these.
customer_reviews.author: M. Steinkampf

customer_reviews.title: pretty surprising. keep in mind when researching
customer_reviews.text: works perfectly and is quieter than the honda i had for my houseboat. pretty surprising. keep in mind when researching, every dpi added means double the noise. don't be fooled!
customer_reviews.author: felicia beckham

customer_reviews.title: Great little generator; just wish it had an oil gauge.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Southern California and bought this after we lost power for a long time and because I'm paranoid about earthquakes. It's very easy to use, very light and very quiet. My only complaint is that it does not have an oil gauge, and it is very easy to over-fill. That said, I admit that I have few mechanical skills, so the lack of an oil gauge might not be an issue for you.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great generator! Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Great generator! Quiet...in fact, I used it next to someone at a motorcycle track day who had the Honda EU2000 and the Yamaha was a tad quieter. The only drawback is that I cannot run 2 sets of tire warmers off of the generator consistently. The tire warmers I and my friends use are the Moto-D Pro Series warmers, which draw about 1,200 watts peak (per pair) when set on 'high.' This generator can run 2 sets of tire warmers when they are both on 'low' setting, though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Koo

customer_reviews.title: Bit the bullet
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a small and easily portable genset, I didn't really want to spend this much money but the other reviews encouraged me and I bought... Glad I did, this unit starts on the first pull and runs quiet. Provided many hours of clean power, on a recent trip to an off the grid location and was sure glad to have it.. Easy on gas and the ears...go ahead, you wont have to regret it...
customer_reviews.author: Greg Kelly Gempler

customer_reviews.title: Great little generator/inverter
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy to start and it is pretty quiet. We tried it out to see if it will power the A/C on our small trailer, it does just fine. Very pleased with its performance thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Carol O.

customer_reviews.title: Made my trip a A++ experience.
customer_reviews.text: Spent 2 months camping in Alaska this summer and purchased this for that trip for times we were in remote areas. Performed as advertised and more. Very quiet and didn't disturb other campers and did run 10 hours on a tank of gas. It was rained on, sleeted on & snowed on and typically started on the first pull. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Dodson

customer_reviews.title: QUIET
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It’s a a Yamaha, you get what you pay for! Quiet, efficient and portable.
customer_reviews.author: missusms

customer_reviews.title: Very good investment
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet and very economical to run. I have 120 hours on the unit and I am very satisfied up to this point. When running at 3000 rpm's the unit ran over 10 1/2 hours on a tank of gas. I bought the optional fuel cap so I could connect it to an external OMC fuel tank, it ran continuously for over 3 days without a flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Ricluse11

customer_reviews.title: Super Generator
customer_reviews.text: Great product from a great company. It is compact and very reliable. It's also very quiet in operation. We should get many years of service from this product. I also like the fact that I can purchase another generator like this one and daisy chain them together to provide more capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Gresham

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT...
customer_reviews.text: If you can afford it, buy it...There's almost no equal at the moment...I like the versatility of it, I can get a second one (IF I REALLY NEEDED IT) and run them in tandem effortlessly for a total of 4,000 watts...Sweet...It absolutely outperforms anything else...
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for emergencies, and hand-portable
customer_reviews.text: During an extended power outage shortly after I received this, I was amazed at how quiet it was. Neighbors had these beastly, gas-guzzling monstrosities, but this hand-carried beauty kept me working for days with amazing fuel efficiency, since many gas stations ran out.
customer_reviews.author: S. Balog

customer_reviews.title: It does not disappoint. It is easy to start
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this generator mainly for yardwork when I was too far away from the house to use an extension cord. It does not disappoint. It is easy to start, simple to use, and is very very quiet. I cant imagine anyone being disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: lucylovesit

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints. I have had mine for just over a year with no issues. Runs good, will run all night on the Eco mode and is super quiet. I have friends who say, "should have got a Honda . . .," but I am super happy with this Yamaha and I paid a lot less for it. I have taken it everywhere I need power and I have zero complaints and am super satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: R. Robins

customer_reviews.title: A No Brainer
customer_reviews.text: Ordered with prime next day delivery for the hurricane. Arrived amazingly fast just as amazon promised. Over a hundred reviews weren't wrong. It is just as described. Started in one pull after adding gas and oil. Worked perfectly Powered a full sized refrig, 42" LCD, cable box, DVD player, and a light, no problem. Would have probably powered more but no sense in pushing it. It is quiet and light. Ok. So maybe the oil filler neck could have been a bit more convenient but I made it work. If I had a $1.45 small funnel it would have been easier... Buy it and save the $200 more you would have paid for he comparable Honda.
customer_reviews.author: A31unit

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this generator
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this generator. Lightweight. Quiet. Always starts right up. Hardly uses any fuel. I love the low idle feature, however if you want to use something that draws a lot of juice, you need to turn that feature off and just let it run wide open.
customer_reviews.author: CandB

customer_reviews.title: Started on the very first and very easy pull. I was amazed
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived I Filled it with gas, oil. Started on the very first and very easy pull. I was amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are accurate. This unit is quite under low load. We had it about 15-20 feet away and it did not disrupt our conversation. During heavy load it does ramp up and is significantly louder but still tolerable. It is light enough to pack in and out of our trailer and the rubber feet keep it from sliding around when moving.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha EF200iS Generator
customer_reviews.text: A great product. Out of the box, you add a little oil and gas. I pushed the prime button a few times then pulled the cord. Started on the very first pull. Extrememly quiet, which is what I need since I'm using it to drive a musical instrument. Case stayed cool during operation. With the smart switch turned on, this unit runs only at the speed necessary to drive the load. A great fuel saving feature.
customer_reviews.author: James Quashnock

customer_reviews.title: Hurrycane Sandy  here in NJ
customer_reviews.text: put my generator to work for a couple of days and it perfomed flawlessly and most important, quietly. Many owners had their generators stolen by "jackals" during and after Sandy. In many instances the noise from the generator attracted these varmints to the places.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tosti

customer_reviews.title: Excellent "work horse".
customer_reviews.text: Excellent unit. We used it in PR and worked great for 1300 hours during the power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Bosch

customer_reviews.title: work like a tonka
customer_reviews.text: Im from Puerto Rico, After Maria, i buy 2 of this, i use 10 to 12 hours a day each one, only 1 us gal give me a lot of rentability in each machie, fully recomended, 100%. I use 2 frezzers, 1.1 amp, one refrigerator, 4 fan, work like a tonka. Thanks yamaha for make high quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Everything and more
customer_reviews.text: Researched generators for several days and was biased towards honda but after reading reviews about the Yamaha I was sold. The price was also good and so far it meets all of my expectations. This unit is extremely quiet and runs all day when in economy mode. The ease of starting is amazing; barely a pull and it is running.
customer_reviews.author: J Lane

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, top quality product
customer_reviews.text: This generator is very quiet (especially when in eco mode). We've taken it camping and used it to power coffee makers, lights, chargers, boom boxes and it is great. You definitely get what you pay for. This is a quality product, made in Japan. It will last you forever if you take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Marko

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small generators
customer_reviews.text: Excellent - quiet, efficient, good power. Ran them in parallel for a few hours. Great little generators and can carry with 1 hand.
customer_reviews.author: Bell Ringer

customer_reviews.title: Efficient
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed thus far. Ran over 12 hrs on a tank. Quite, lightweight, efficient and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: What a Grrrreat little, SUPER quiet generator!
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind it's 2000watt output is initial max surge. Sustained operation of 1,600 watts (calculate your needs). If this is adequate you get a super quiet, lightweight, portable generator with XLNT technology and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kris O.

customer_reviews.title: Very user-friendly
customer_reviews.text: I got this primarily for my travel trailer, though it's not powerful enough to run A/C or multiple appliances. The economy mode is great since it quietly idles under light load and cranks up as needed. Filling the oil is messy - I put too much in, so a lot of it spilled and the overflow is still seeping out. Next time I'll use a turkey baster to fill the oil. I also wish that there was another way to reset the generator after an overload other than shutting it down and restarting it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: No regrets,very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: After reading and comparing,this is the generator we picked and after 2 weeks in the Canadian north we love it. Easy to start, very quiet and low fuel consumption.The only suggestion I would make to Yamaha is a hour meter for maintenance or you can just dump the oil every season. This is a high quality machine and better bang for my money than a Honda.
customer_reviews.author: Law

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Took it out on our first camping trip this past weekend. Worked great, very quiet. Got over 9 hours of tun time on a tank running 2-fans all night in our tents. Would definitely recommend this generator.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Thurmond Jr

customer_reviews.title: Happy with our Yamaha generator
customer_reviews.text: Bought this generator to power our travel trailer when dry camping. It's quiet and powers everything including the ac. We added a hard start capacitor to the ac for startup. It wouldn't start the ac without the addition of the capacitor. Glad we spent the extra money and got the Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Larson

customer_reviews.title: Best Choice!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has all the power you could hope for in a lite weight fuel efficent generator. It started up on the very first pull out of the box and is so quiet, especially in the fuel saving mode. It has 2 speeds which are manually selected for lite or heavy loads. Pony up the money for this high quality gen that you won't regret. So glad I didnt go with a cheaper model. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: William R. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Very Portable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this generator because of its size which makes it very portable. A good feature is that engine will throttle down depending on the load, which improves fuel consumption and noise. The generator starts easily and runs quietly even under full load. Some reviewers may the Yamaha a little pricey, as for me it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Netforager

customer_reviews.title: Great Inverter
customer_reviews.text: This inverter is great! I run a small fridge, TV, light, PS4 all at the same time. I can also run a 5000btu air conditioner by itself.
customer_reviews.author: R. lynch

customer_reviews.title: Product Review
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly and well protected. We bought this as a "Back-Up" power system for our RV and haven't had to use it yet although we have hooked it up for service twice to get used to it. It works great and is easily started. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow the best ever
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 2 years, bought from amazon... I'm 65 years old and this is the 6th or 7th generator I've owned, this is by far the best ever. Everything you have read that's good, is an under estimate. It sat for 8 months. Turned on the gas and choke pulled the cord 3 times and VOOOOOM, smooth as glass and quiet as a mouse. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Quite as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Quite as advertised. I only wish the handle was made out of much stronger material so I could use a security cable without worrying about somebody sawing through the plastic handle
customer_reviews.author: vyacheslav bobik

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes you get what you pay for. There's a lot of cheaper generators, but this one was well worth the money. Very quiet and starts on the first pull. I used Honda before, but found this one a little cheaper and it works just as good.
customer_reviews.author: cory

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best! Read reviews and comparisons
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best! Read reviews and comparisons, and you'll probably agree. Comparable Honda unit is a second in almost every review. Keep an eye out for Amazon Warehouse Deals for value.
customer_reviews.author: Louis M. White

customer_reviews.title: Small, powerful, dependable
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy, but I can carry it with one hand if need be. Powerful, quiet, and dependable generator that puts out AC at 120 volts. It's a 4-stroke, so it has its own oil, so no mixing oil with the gasoline. Easy to start, too.
customer_reviews.author: kkrome25

customer_reviews.title: Best phase to date has great features that the Honda ...
customer_reviews.text: Best phase to date has great features that the Honda does not and is quieter and runs longer on the same amount of fuel. Can't say enough good about this generator
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A.

customer_reviews.title: Great little generator with ease of start, store, and maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this generator for my dad so when he is parked and resting (he is a Truck driver) he can power is A/C (5000 BTU), without running his truck. This little generator starts with just one pull every time (this means alot especially if you are tired). The fuel will last 5-6 hours while using the A/C, 11-12 hours with a fan. Maintenance is very easy to accomplish (oil and spark plug change). The size of the genny is perfect to fit in a storage bin and very easy to manuever.
customer_reviews.author: bruno a. cox

customer_reviews.title: Great Generator, and Yamaha doesn't suck so bad!
customer_reviews.text: No complaint's about the generator, easy to use, fast to start, very fuel efficient, but this is the last one I'll buy from Yamaha. I misplaced the manual, so I went for the quick PDF download, they want $20 for the owner's manual. Honda's manuals offer a free download. A $1000 generator and they want to soak customers for another $20 for the manuals. I'd buy two Honda generators before I'd give those ripoffs $20 for the manual. Edited to add, thanks for the links, not sure why Yamaha wanted me to pay $20, but it's nice I can download the PDF. Again it is a great little generator, apparently I just had a SNAFU with customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha EF2000iSv2 Fantastic little machine
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased for our bounce house. Start it and it takes off like a champ and has no problems keeping up with the needed power.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but....
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this Yamaha EF2000iS just to run my sump pump during power outage. Got it in less than 3 days, subsequently in two days I put oil and gas and started it in one pull. Having heard my neighbors generator before, this one is so quite. Expensive but I'm happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: FAR

customer_reviews.title: I have owned a 3000EFI Remote start Yamaha before and it was a good running machine
customer_reviews.text: Very fast delivery, will keep buying from Amazon. I have owned a 3000EFI Remote start Yamaha before and it was a good running machine. I bought this smaller one for my truck camper and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gordy

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and efficient generator
customer_reviews.text: This is a great generator. It is quiet and efficient. Very easy to start, usually in one pull. It is portable and easy to carry. The only drawback it is very expensive but cheaper than the equivalent Honda model.
customer_reviews.author: Pjisimo

customer_reviews.title: I'm more than happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Not the most powerful generator out there, but for the cost and value provided, I'm more than happy with it. Used on my boat to light up holiday lights and it's going camping next.
customer_reviews.author: Hratch Nerkizian

customer_reviews.title: It works great, and is much smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the office to run hammer drills and other small hand tools off of. It works great, and is much smaller than expected. It's easy on fuel as well. A tank will last a whole day of work.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with it! Quiet, easy to start, light and portable. Haven't really had the need to use it (other than firing it up every 6 months for a few minutes) since I have a large UPS that can carry my sump pump needs for 24 hrs. I'm sure if the need arrises it will work like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Kyriakos Georgiou

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Got the Yamaha generator and it came packaged very secure. adding oil was very easy. Put some fresh gas in and it started right up. we had a BBQ competition that weekend and used the generator for two days straight! worked great and no problems what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: xburb

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived intact and undamaged. Packaging was like new. Added oil and gas and started right up. Very satisfied with this purchase and the price.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Quite Reliable RV Generator
customer_reviews.text: Works good for camping and can drive a 900 Watt microwave while charging batteries and running lights. A little light to make a great home emergency backup unless you buy two (could get a little expensive). There are many less expensive home backup generators that would work better for home emergency power outages. I'm sure this one will give the alternative "Red Brand" a run for it's money.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Power out for seven days due to hurricane Sandy. This generator made it all bearable. Ran my refrigerator, lights and tv. Helped make things normal. A fantastic machine. In addition, we had a severe gas shortage in NJ and this unit is so economical I didn't have to worry. At about a gallon a day, when used judiciously, it is a remarkably efficient generator. Plus it's so quiet my neighbors hardly knew it was on. Worth every penny, don't compromise!
customer_reviews.author: Ifittakesallsummer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Generator. i used for Five months 12 hours ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Generator. i used for Five months 12 hours everyday in the hurricane Maria emergency. No problems 1 gallon of gasoline for 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: It was this one or the honda... i went with this one because of the better warranty and the lower part throttle fuel consumption... i have had it a week and good so far :) it has worked 16 hour days and not a peep of complain. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Great generator
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little generator. Used it going camping several times. It will power everything in my 5th wheel except for the a/c. Very quiet as far as generators go. I have used the Honda 2000 invertor generators too and this generator does everything the Hondas will do for less money. And with it being a Yamaha, you can still trust the brand. Can't beat the free 2 day shipping on it either! (If your a prime member...)
customer_reviews.author: srk67

customer_reviews.title: Great little generator
customer_reviews.text: We use this generator at our cabin to run an 8000 BTU air conditioner when the heat and humidity become unbearable. It runs the air conditioner without difficulty and would probably run a 10000 btu if we could fit one into our small window openings. I cannot use the econo mode while the air is running but the sound of the air conditioner drowns out the minimal noise from the generator anyway. We love our new Yamaha generator and would recommend it to anyone. Starts first pull every time.
customer_reviews.author: Crash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Generator
customer_reviews.text: This Yamaha is far superior than my friends Honda! I have a 8,000 watt Honda but needed something smaller so decided on Yamaha. Gas gauge and 12 volt charging excellent features. Runs very quiet. Great price for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: M W of Pleasanton

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha EF2000iS, 1600 Running Watts/2000.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I have not used for a power outage yet but I start monthly and put a load on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Most quiet generator
customer_reviews.text: This device has saved me three times, now! Once during a storm and the other two rescued my RV.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great generator, works as advertised, very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Awesome generator. Cranks easily, runs quietly, dependable. Runs quite a while on one fillup of gas. The adjustable throttle setting is great for when you do not have a full load on it.
customer_reviews.author: R U Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, fairly quite. Can't run too much else with the microwave is running but that is not a surprise. Plenty of YouTube videos on changing the oil.
customer_reviews.author: Hjul

product_meta.title: Yamaha EF2000iSv2, 1600 Running Watts/2000 Starting Watts, Gas Powered Portable Inverter,Blue
product_meta.description:
Yamaha 1600 Running Watts/2000 Starting Watts Gas Powered Portable Inverter, Blue. Fuel Type - Unleaded Regular

AMAZON.COM
Powerful, portable, and efficient, the Yamaha EF2000iS Gas-Powered Portable Inverter delivers maximum electrical output without sacrificing portability. Thanks to its innovative inverter system, the generator is able to generate up to 2,000 watts of clean AC power. It can run up to 10.5 hours continuously without refueling and uses premium technologies to maximize fuel efficiency.
feature_bullets: 1600 watt rated AC output, 2000 watt maximum AC output, 13.3/16.7 amps @ 120V
Super-quiet muffler with USFS-approved spark arrestor - 51.5 dBA at 1/4 load
Smart Throttle varies engine speed based on load - improves fuel economy and reduces noise
Inverter system with Pulse Width Modulation (PWM) control

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars473 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars

categories: Jump Starters, Battery Chargers & Portable Power
